comment.author: 65105123@N06
comment._content: Or as a pretext for pillaging the shop

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: From www.greatwardifferent.com/Great_War/Paris_6/Paris_Waits_0... 'Paris Waits 1914' by M.E. Clarke, An Englishman in Paris in 1914 "Less picturesque incidents of the last two weeks were those which showed us bands of rough men and boys going round the city with hatchets, destroying all property that was marked by a German name, or anything approaching a German name. "
